posts.name: Jyoti Singh
posts.cooked:
@carlton @s.anand
Dear Sir,

I am currently working with the Chennai:50 dataset, and I am experiencing difficulties with questions 11, 12, 13, and 15. Despite my efforts, the answers I derive continue to be marked as incorrect. I have reviewed my calculations extensively and believe my answers should be correct, yet they are not accepted.

I have been attempting to resolve this issue for the past two days, and it has been a source of considerable stress, especially as this project accounts for 20% of my total score. I am attaching the code I used for these questions. I have also sought assistance from some senior students, who reviewed and tested the code but encountered the same issues, with answers still being marked as incorrect.
question 12

Screenshot 2024-10-30 1011071430×991 59 KB

question 15

Screenshot 2024-10-30 1013131433×968 52.3 KB

please help me out with this as it is very important part of the course.

posts.name: Anand Iyer
posts.cooked:
@22f3000182 , you’ve tagged the wrong Anand in your post. It should be S.Anand.

I am a student in this program.

posts.name: Jyoti Singh
posts.cooked: ohh sorry sir, i misunderstood it because of the same name.

posts.name: Sid
posts.cooked:
By just looking at the code, the only suggestion I have is to change hireable column values in csv file to lowercase (e.g. true and not True). Also review the content of column has_email and others. As per the Project instructions -

For booleans, use true and false and empty strings for null.

posts.name: Jyoti Singh
posts.cooked: tried everything. still not getting the answers as correct but i am pretty sure that my answers are correct. i tried hard refresh, checked my csv files and created them again and every possible thing to solve this issue. but still facing it

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Did you try what @22f3003031 mentioned? As in

  1. change the values in your .csv to the right values, then
  2. upload the new files to your repository,
  3. then resubmit the answers with the new repo details?

Because the Check Answers does validation on your own dataset that you upload. If the spec is not followed EXACTLY as mentioned the script will give you erroneous results.

Kind regards
